arts.ttl: Sunderland vows strong action after Romaine Mundle suffers racist abuse online
arts.sum: The 21-year-old was targeted in the wake of Saturday’s 1-0 defeat by Hull.

arts.ttl: Ruben Selles makes Reading joke after Hull City's fine win at Sunderland
arts.sum: Anthony Patterson's own goal early in the Stadium of Light contest was enough to separate the two sides, with City bagging a fourth away win in their last five games and inflicting a first home league loss on the Black Cats in front of their biggest home crowd this term of just over 44,000. This win, coupled with results elsewhere has moved City three points clear of the bottom three, at least until Luton Town play Watford on Sunday and gives them some breathing space for the first time in some time.

arts.ttl: Championship roundup: blunder hands Hull shock win at Sunderland
arts.sum: Humbersiders raise survival hopes with 1-0 victory Plymouth and Cardiff draw; Millwall win at Derby The Sunderland goalkeeper Anthony Patterson’s first-half error helped boost Hull’s survival chances with a hard-earned 1-0 win at the Stadium of Light. Patterson flapped Joe Gelhardt’s corner in the 18th minute into his own net, putting Hull on course for a fourth win from their last five away matches. Sunderland, who struggled to get into their rhythm after losing at promotion rivals Leeds on Monday, could not find a way back and slipped to consecutive defeats for the first time this season. This story will be updated Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Hull City player ratings as Eliot Matazo and the defence impress in crucial Sunderland victory
arts.sum: Sunderland rarely threatened and City could have won it by a clearer margin had Matt Crooks' clever backheel not been disallowed in the second period. Did pick up a cheap booking before the break, but played that sensibly in the second period.

arts.ttl: Patterson OG costs Sunderland as they lose to Hull
arts.sum: Sunderland goalkeeper Anthony Patterson's first-half error helped boost Hull's survival chances with a hard-earned 1-0 win at the Stadium of Light.

arts.ttl: Superb Hull City beat Sunderland to secure huge away win at Stadium of Light
arts.sum: Selles made three changes from the team he sent out against Norwich City a week ago, with Charlie Hughes coming straight back into the team after a 10-game absence with a hamstring injury at the expense of John Egan, who dropped to the bench, where he was joined by Regan Slater and Joao Pedro, with their places being taken by Eliot Matazo and Kyle Joseph respectively. City's settling into the contest was rewarded when Joseph chased down a lost cause to win a corner and from that, Gelhardt's kick was headed in at the near post by Patrick Roberts, the ball going straight through Patterson's hands.

arts.ttl: Anthony Patterson error hands Hull victory over Sunderland
arts.sum: The Black Cats keeper pushed Joe Gelhardt’s corner into his own net for the only goal.

arts.ttl: Saturday's Championship predictions including Sunderland vs. Hull City
arts.sum: Sports Mole provides score predictions and previews for all of today's Championship fixtures, including Sunderland vs. Hull City.

arts.ttl: What Ruben Selles said on the relegation scrap ahead of Hull City's trip to Sunderland
arts.sum: Being in the bottom echelons of the league adds a very different pressure to challenging at the top of the league, especially when you know what relegation can mean for those away from the playing side of the club, and for a club like City, who have invested heavily to try and chase the Premier League dream. We accept the situation that is going to be in and around us until the end of the season, and that's the first thing," the Spaniard tells Hull Live in a discussion about working under the very real threat of what would be a disastrous relegation.

arts.ttl: Hull City must prove Sheffield United display wasn't a flash in the pan
arts.sum: Like the Blades were, Sunderland is unbeaten at home in the Championship this season with 10 wins and six draws from their 16 Stadium of Light encounters - you can feel every Tigers fan reading that line with sheer envy, wondering what such form must be like to enjoy in their own stadium. Hull City's stunning 3-0 win at Sheffield United last month captured the imagination of fans and pundits alike as Ruben Selles' outfit swept aside the Blades in mesmerising fashion.
